speaker: Outstanding Guest Actor in a Comedy Series
text: John Glover  * * *  ## Transcript {john masson}    **HEARD IT THROUGH THE GRAPEVINE**  _Scene A: Caf e Nervosa. Frasier and Niles are there._

speaker: Niles
text: So I just had to get out of the house.  Maris's Junior League are rehearsing their spring musical - this year they're doing "Cats."  The past week and a half I've been watching two dozen underweight, tightly-pulled woman in leotards crawling round the music room, meowing.  I'm telling you Frasier, my allergies are acting up.
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Guest Actor in a Comedy Series

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Niles, I think you're exaggerating.

speaker: Niles
text: No.  No, really.  You've no idea how vivid the experience is. As God is my judge, I swear, Mrs. Presley-Bismouth was scent- marking the divan.

speaker: Frasier
text: God, you'd think women of that age would choose more suitable material.  Remember the last show they did, "The Sound Of Music"?  My God, half the Von Trapp children were having hot flashes.

speaker: Roz
text: Hi, Frasier, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Let me guess.  The wacky gang from the office?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_making introductions_] Everyone, this is my brother Niles. This is Teddy, one of our brilliant engineers..

speaker: Teddy
text: [_shaking hands_] Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Teddy, my man!

speaker: Frasier
text: This is KACL's inimitable "Chopper" Dave.  Your Eye in the Sky for traffic.

speaker: Dave
text: [_loudly_] NICE TO MEET YOU, NILES!

speaker: Niles
text: [_to Frasier_] Why is this man yelling?

speaker: Dave
text: Oh, was I yelling?  Oh god, I was yelling again, wasn't I? I'm sorry, talking over the blades, you know?  Whoomp- whoomp-whoomp-whoomp-whoomp-whoomp...

speaker: Niles
text: This has been kind of fun, ah, but I really have to go.  I'm conducting a seminar on multiple personality disorders, and it takes me forever to fill out the name tags. [_leaves_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, KACL team, what is on the agenda for today?

speaker: Roz
text: Sit down and listen to this.  I got a juicy piece of news, and it's reliable.  Alan in Accounting got it from Steven in Promotions, who got it from Cindy in Retail Sales, who got it from Arlene, the station manager's secretary - that the station is definitely way over budget, and somebody's getting the ax.  But don't tell anybody, I was sworn to secrecy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, I'm ashamed of you!  Gossip, gossip, gossip.  Don't you know how destructive that can be?  It does nothing but sully good people's names and create an atmosphere of suspicion and mistrust.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, lighten up.  Gossip is the lifeblood of the corporate world.  If it wasn't for gossip, we wouldn't know any of the important things, like how much everybody makes.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know my salary?

speaker: Dave
text: NO-ONE'S SALARY'S A SECRET AROUND HERE.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Ninety-four, ninety-five, ninety-six, ninety-seven...

speaker: Teddy
text: Hey, Bulldog.  How's it going?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Great -- ninety-eight, ninety-nine, one hundred! - new high for me.

speaker: Roz
text: Squeezing or counting?

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_barks at Roz, then goes to counter_] Java to go.

speaker: Dave
text: YOU KNOW WHO I THINK'S GETTING DUMPED?  FATHER MIKE FROM "RELIGION ON THE LINE."

speaker: Roz
text: No way.  Station loves him.  Just gave him a big bonus.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, where's my tickets to the Sonics game?  They were here just a second ago. [_hits the counter_] SOMEBODY STOLE MY TICKETS TO THE SONICS GAME!  THIS STINKS!  THIS IS TOTAL B.S! THIS IS... [_checks another pocket_] oh, got 'em.  Got 'em.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey.  You guys don't think it's Bulldog who's getting canned?

speaker: Teddy
text: Could be.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no no no no.  He's the station's highest-rated personality. I mean, with the exception of women thirty-five to fifty-four who happen to think that I'm... sort of a god.

speaker: Teddy
text: But he has been in that salary beef with management.

speaker: Roz
text: And I heard him screaming at business affairs for putting his expense account on hold.

speaker: Dave
text: OH YEAH, BULLDOG'S OUT!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey.  Have you heard about my new gimmick for the show?  If the Seahawks beat Buffalo this Sunday, I promise to do my entire show hanging by my feet.

speaker: Frasier
text: You can do that?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh, sure.  Practiced all morning.  The real trick is drinking coffee.  I keep burning my eyes.  Hey, Dave.  Want my tickets to the Sonics Game tonight?

speaker: Dave
text: [_takes them_] THANKS!  WHY AREN'T YOU GOING?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Ah, station manager wants to see me after work.

speaker: Teddy/Dave/Roz
text: Ooh...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh people, people.  You're jumping to conclusions.  Show a little respect.  Bulldog has devoted fifteen years of his life to radio.  My own personal feelings aside, the man deserves better than to become the object of some scurrilous rumor that as yet hasn't a shred of truth to it.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah.  I suppose you're right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well... just in case, I've got dibs on his parking space. [_leaves_] **DID I DO THAT?**  _Scene B: Radio Station. Frasier is doing his show._

speaker: Roz
text: Dr. Crane, we have Don on his car phone.  He's having a problem with his weight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Don, it's a common problem.  I'm listening.

speaker: Don
text: [_v.o._] Ah, it's the screwiest thing, Doc.  I eat healthy, I work out.  But no matter what I do, I can't lose a pound, it's very depressing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, losing weight can be a lifelong struggle.  It takes a commitment.  Now, if you're ready to accept that, there are a number of things I can suggest...

speaker: Waitress
text: [_v.o., in background_] May I take your order, please?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh Don, what was that?

speaker: Don
text: Ah -- oh, nothing.  It was the radio.  Go ahead, you were talking.

speaker: Frasier
text: Don...?  Where are you?

speaker: Don
text: I'm just driving around.

speaker: Waitress
text: [_v.o._] Hey, speak into the clown's mouth!

speaker: Frasier
text: Don...?

speaker: Don
text: Sorry, Dr. Crane. [_imitates static_] I'm going to lose you. I'm going into a tunnel.  Goodbye! [_hangs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and the light at the end of that tunnel is a heat lamp over a large order of fries.  We'll be right back after the news.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey Frasier, I've got to run up to payroll, be back in five.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay.  _He steps into the corridor, where he meets Father Mike at the candy machine._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi Father Mike.

speaker: Mike
text: Oh, hello Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: How you doing?

speaker: Mike
text: Say, I just heard a rumor that somebody 'round here is being let go.  Do you know anything about that, because to tell you the truth, I'm afraid it might be me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Father, Father.  You should better than to put any stock in idle office gossip.

speaker: Mike
text: I know, I know.  But it's hard not to.  My numbers have been down lately, they keep changing my timeslot.  I'm really bummed!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, listen Father.  I don't like to engage in gossip, but you have nothing to worry about.

speaker: Mike
text: Yes?  Why?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, someone is being let go...

speaker: Mike
text: Oh?

speaker: Frasier
text: But ah, it's not you.  It's Bulldog.

speaker: Mike
text: Bulldog? Oh, what a shame.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Mike
text: Has anybody spoken for his parking space?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well I have, yes.  _Frasier goes back into the booth to find that Bulldog has been standing behind the door, and has heard every word._

speaker: Bulldog
text: So I'm a goner, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: Bulldog.  Well, how long have you been...?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Long enough to know I'm the one who's out. [_starts banging head on table_] I knew it, I knew it, I knew it!  Damn it! Now I know why Ned Miller wants to see me after work.  It's to can my butt.  I mean, why else would he be willing to miss happy hour at El Paquito's?  The man's a total boozer!

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, now now now now, Bulldog listen, this is just a rumor. You know how out of the loop I am.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh, yeah.  And after all I've done for this lousy station, this is how they repay me?  Well, that's it!  Nobody fires Bob Briscoe!  I'll quit first.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, now now.  Don't do anything rash.  Now listen, I suggest you try to vent your anger first.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... there, way to go.  Now, on your way.

speaker: Bulldog
text: You're damn right. [_he leaves, as Roz returns_]

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Bulldog.

speaker: Bulldog
text: No time to talk, slim, I'm off to war! _He exits, then dashes back in, grabs Roz, and gives her a deep kiss. Before she can resist, he lets her go._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Wait for me.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh! [_to Frasier_] What was that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Bulldog's quitting.

speaker: Roz
text: Why?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, because Ned Miller is firing him.

speaker: Roz
text: Who told you that?

speaker: Frasier
text: You did.

speaker: Roz
text: That was just a rumor... You didn't tell him that, did you?!

speaker: Frasier
text: I didn't mean to, he overheard me.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, God!

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  Come on, you guys were so positive - the expense account thing, the meeting with management at five?

speaker: Roz
text: That meeting was to discuss taking his show national!  Don't you know anything that goes on around here?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Apparently not!

speaker: Roz
text: Well, don't just stand there.  Go call his secretary, she'll stop him before he gets in.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't believe this, this is incredible, [_on phone_] Yes, hello, hello Arlene?  Arlene, yes, listen.  Bob Briscoe's about to jump into the office and... oh. [_replaces phone_] God, he's already burst into the office with Miller.  Oh god, this is a disaster.

speaker: Roz
text: Maybe not, maybe not.  Maybe before Bulldog starts anything Miller will tell him what the meeting was really about.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well I, I suppose you're right.  For all we know they may be having a good laugh about this right now.  _Cut to station manager's point of view (shown through a fish-eye camera lens).  Bulldog is in his face, telling him off.  But instead of words, we hear dog-like barking and snarling.  Cut back to the booth._

speaker: Roz
text: Grab that mike. We're out of the news in one minute.

speaker: Bulldog
text: I did it!  I scorched him! [_laughs maniacally_] You should have seen the look on his face.  Oh, I even told him about the time his wife came on to me at the Christmas party.  I said there wasn't enough liquor in the world to make me sleep with that porker!

speaker: Frasier
text: You said that to Ned Miller?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yes!  Yeah, he even took a swing at me.  I gave him a little okey-doke and he hit air!

speaker: Frasier
text: My god, the man tried to strike you?  Listen, Bulldog...

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, hey!  No sudden moves, doc.  I'm still too pumped. I feel like poppin' someone. [_he leaves_]

speaker: Frasier
text: My god, my god, this is unbelievable. [_to Roz_] A man has quit his job just because of a rumor that you spread!

speaker: Roz
text: Me?!  The whole point of gossip is to talk behind the person's back, not in front of him.  I didn't realize you were unclear on this concept!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm a bad, bad man. [_hangs head in shame_]

speaker: Roz
text: Well Frasier, you have got to do something.  You gotta call Ned Miller and get this whole thing cleared up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, right.  "Call Ned Miller, clear this thing up."  The man is totally unstable, he tried to take a swing at me the day he hired me.

speaker: Dave
text: OOH, JUST HEARD A HOT RUMOUR!  BULLDOG QUIT!

speaker: Frasier
text: No kidding.

speaker: Dave
text: BUT KEEP IT UNDER YOUR HAT!  VERY HUSH-HUSH! [_leaves_]  _End of Act One.  Act Two._ **ONE DOG NIGHT**  _Scene C: Frasier's Apartment. Martin opens the door for Niles._

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, what brings you here?

speaker: Niles
text: [_carrying a dead plant_] Well, I was hoping Daphne could take a look at this plant.  I bought it for Maris but it unaccountably turned against her.  I thought Daphne was the perfect person to nurse it back to health with her soft, sensual hands and her loving... manner.  Is she here?

speaker: Martin
text: No, she stepped out.  I don't know when she'll be back.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm off. [_goes towards door_]

speaker: Martin
text: What, hey!  You can stay.  I haven't seen you for a while, you can visit.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, yes we could, couldn't we?

speaker: Niles
text: ...So, how are ya?

speaker: Martin
text: Fine.  You?

speaker: Niles
text: Fine... She's fine.

speaker: Martin
text: ...Pickle?

speaker: Niles
text: No, thanks.

speaker: Martin
text: ...Look Niles, if you just came to see Daphne, you don't have to stay.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, I can't believe you would say that.  To your own son. I am deeply insulted.  Here I wanted to have some time with you but now I'm so upset I'll have to leave. [_heads towards door again, just as Daphne enters_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, hello Dr. Crane.  Staying for dinner?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, love to.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, I had the fervent hope that you could coax this back to life.  It's one of Maris's favorites.

speaker: Daphne
text: My goodness, what did she do to it?

speaker: Niles
text: Nothing.  Just loved it.

speaker: Frasier
text: God.  Can you believe this weather?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Frasier.  I'm glad you're home.  What happened to Bulldog?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_panic-stricken_] Who told you?

speaker: Martin
text: Nobody told me anything.  I turned into the "Gonzo Sports Show" today like I always do, and they had Father Mike filling in. I hate that.  All it was, was "Notre Dame, Notre Dame, Notre Dame."

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, Bulldog tended his resignation.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no.  Why would he do that?  He's the top sports guy in town.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, things just go funny sometimes.  It's a tough business, this radio game, you know?

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, I'm picking up something from you.  You're shrouded in an aura of guilt.

speaker: Frasier
text: ...Maybe I am.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, that's fantastic.  Do me, do me.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, I'm on to something here. [_to Frasier_] You actually think you're responsible for Bulldog losing his job.

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, all right.  Ah, there was a rumor going �round the station that Bulldog was going to get sacked, and then... I was repeating it to someone and he overheard me and flew off the handle, went up and quit his job.  In the end it turned out that the rumor wasn't true. [_to Daphne_] Of course, you already knew that, didn't you?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, excuse me. [_answers phone_] Hello?  Maris... Maris? What's wrong?  It's all right... no, no.  Everything's going to be... Oh, dear. [_puts phone back in pocket_] Sorry, I have to go.  Maris is despondent.  They kicked her out of the cast of "Cats."

speaker: Daphne
text: Why?

speaker: Niles
text: She couldn't remember the words to "Memory."

speaker: Martin
text: Now listen here, Frasier.  If you're responsible for Bulldog losing his job, you've got to make this right.  You gotta go down to that station and talk to the boss and get him his job back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's a little easier said than done.  Ned Miller is the most intimidating, heartless, mean-spirited man I've ever had the misfortune to meet.

speaker: Daphne
text: And he cheats on his wife... [_realizes_] My goodness, I'm on today.

speaker: Martin
text: So you're selling Bulldog down the river just 'cause you don't have the guts to go and face this guy?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no.  For all we know this might just be the best thing that ever happened to him.  You know, he's always talking about how he should be in a larger market, like Los Angeles, or New York...

speaker: Frasier
text: Eddie, scoot.  Scat. _Frasier opens the door to find Bulldog standing there, bag over his shoulder, very sad and despondent._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Bulldog.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hiya, Doc.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what are you doing, just standing there?

speaker: Bulldog
text: ...I don't know.  I was trying to decide whether or not I should bother you.  See, my life is kinda over, but you got company, so I'll go.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no-no-no-no.  Come in, come in, it's just family.  This is my dad, and Daphne Moon.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Bulldog.  You're soaking wet.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah, I been wandering around the streets for the last few hours.

speaker: Martin
text: I heard what happened.

speaker: Bulldog
text: You haven't heard the half of it. [_grabs Frasier's sherry and throws it back_] My girlfriend threw me out.  She said the only reason she was with me was because I was on the radio.  Can you believe that?  Eight years we've been together.  I loved that woman.  Even when I was tomcatting around, I loved that woman.  God, that job was my life, and now I've been blackballed in this business, and all because of my stupid temper. [_picks up a piece of African art_] What is this, anyway?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's an exceedingly rare fertility symbol from a small nomadic tribe in Ghana.

speaker: Bulldog
text: I guess when they were passing out equipment, this guy was in the back of the line. [_slams it down on the table_] Anyway, I might as well face it, I'm just a loser, I'm a zero, I'm nothing, a has-been..

speaker: Martin
text: Pickle? [_Bulldog accepts_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Now, I'm not familiar with your work myself, but Mr. Crane often puts off his nightly bath just so he can hear your show.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah.  You're the greatest, Bulldog.  If you weren't on the radio, I wouldn't have a radio.

speaker: Bulldog
text: That's a nice thing to say.  Now I know why your son is such a great guy. [_Martin and Daphne turn to stare at Frasier_] I've bothered you people enough.  I better go.  The good rooms at the "Y" fill up early. [_Martin and Daphne stare at Frasier again_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait.  Bulldog, I can't let you leave like this. [_goes into his pocket_] Here's a twenty. [_Martin glares at him_] Oh, all right.  Why don't you just spend the night, you can take the couch.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Wow.  You'd do that for me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Why sure, what's the point of having an expensive suede couch if you can't have a bunch of people crashing on it?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Thanks, Doc.  Hey, I hope it's okay, but I could really use a hot shower.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh sure, sure.

speaker: Daphne
text: Down the hall, second door on the left.  Towels are in the cabinet.  _Bulldog exits down the corridor.  Martin and Daphne go back to staring at Frasier._

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, you two just leave me alone.  This is not my fault. Look, I am not responsible for Bulldog going up there and popping off to the boss.  You can stare at me 'til you're blue in the face, I'm not going to go see Ned Miller.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right!  I'll go down to the station, I will talk to the monster on the sixth floor and futilely attempt to get a man back his job that I don't even care for, and in the process I will probably end up spitting out my teeth like Chiclets!  Is there anything else I can do for you?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, if you're going by the market, we're low on dog food. **IT'S MILLER TIME**  _Scene D: Ned Miller's office. He's hanging a picture as Frasier knocks on the door._

speaker: Miller
text: What, what?!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_entering_] Mr. Miller...

speaker: Miller
text: Oh, it's you, Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, I don't mean to disturb you, but Arlene wasn't at her desk.

speaker: Miller
text: I had to let her go.  A lot of stuff she's been doing lately's been ticking me off.

speaker: Frasier
text: If this is a bad time...

speaker: Miller
text: No, it's a perfect time, I need you to hold this. [_indicating picture_] Come on.  Now!  _Frasier takes the painting and holds it to the wall as Miller stands back._

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, how's this?

speaker: Miller
text: I'd love to tell you, but your big head's in the way.

speaker: Miller
text: Ah, put it down.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my lord!  What happened here?

speaker: Miller
text: Oh, that psycho Bulldog and I got into it this afternoon. He threw my Golden Mike at me!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looking at hole_] And he did that with your little trophy?

speaker: Miller
text: No, he just chipped the paint with the trophy, I did that with his head!

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.  That's, ah, sort of why I'm here.

speaker: Miller
text: Drink?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  No thank you, Mr. Miller.  Um, I know that Bulldog was up here, and he said some... pretty regrettable things to you.

speaker: Miller
text: I'll say he said some things.  You want to hear them?  I tape everything in this office.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well anyway, ah, a lot of what he said was, ah... was my fault, you see?  Well, you see, I heard a rumor that, ah, management was thinking about lightening the load a bit.  Well, I heard it was Bulldog that was gonna get sacked and I... I was repeating the rumor to someone and Bulldog heard me.  And that's why he came up here and started telling you...

speaker: Miller
text: That I'm a drunk, that I'm incompetent at my job, that my wife is a big fat slut!

speaker: Frasier
text: That is indefensible!  Your wife is not overweight! [_realizes_] Well anyway, my point is that, um, I'd like you to reconsider giving Bulldog his job back.  And ah, whatever the consequences to me, I'm willing to accept it.

speaker: Miller
text: Look, I won't kid you.  Bulldog meant big numbers to us in Drive Time, we need him back.  Tell you what - you get him to apologize to me... oh hell, why don't I just say it?  If he'll kiss my ass, maybe we can work something out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh sir, sir, I'm sure that'll make him so happy.  _He stands and holds out his hand, but Miller has already picked up his glass again._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'll just, ah, get out of you hair. [_goes to door_]

speaker: Miller
text: Actually Crane, that uh, rumor about someone being let go is, uh... true.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Miller
text: Now that you've so nobly gotten Bulldog his job back, the station still needs to make some cutbacks on those high-priced salaries.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh god, not Father Mike?  Oh, no.

speaker: Miller
text: No.  It's not Father Mike.

speaker: Frasier
text: Chopper Dave?  Ray the Greengrocer?  Bonnie "the Auto Lady" Weems?

speaker: Miller
text: Look, Crane.  You're new to the radio game, I've been around a long time.  People get fired.  But they always get back on their feet.  So... I bet you I could get you that drink now?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I bet you could.

speaker: Miller
text: [_the phone rings_] Help yourself.

speaker: Miller
text: Ned Miller!  Yo, Jack!  No, what's wrong?  Ah, come on, tell me now.  Uh-huh.  I see.  No, no no, I-I... Thanks, Jack. _Frasier has taken a stiff drink of Scotch, and is about to pour himself a second.  Miller replaces the phone, and takes the decanter from Frasier's hand before he can pour._

speaker: Miller
text: Excuse me. [_fills his glass_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Bad news?

speaker: Miller
text: Oh, you could say that.  I've just been fired.  They decided the best way to cut the budget was to get rid of MY high salary.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_struggles to hide his grin_] Oh, Ned, I... I'm so sorry. Then I guess this means that my job is still safe, then?

speaker: Miller
text: Yeah.  I guess so.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_expansively_] Well, you know Ned... I haven't been in the radio game that long.  But, uh, I've been around long enough to know that people get fired.  And when they do, they always seem to land on their feet.  Now I've known quite a few people - and counseled them - that have suffered similar setbacks.  But, ah, in time you will embrace this.  Learn to think of this as, oh, a new chapter.  You know, in theatrical circles, they always say "Every exit is but an entrance to somewhere else."

speaker: Miller
text: God, I wish I'd fired you when I had the chance!
